alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 22 at 3:32AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Heavy Rain and Potential Flooding Forecast Late This Week... After a mid week pause, look for rain chances to ramp up again as we approach the end of the work week. An evolving storm system will make its move toward us Thursday, with heavy rain expected late Thursday night through Friday evening. Forecast average storm total rainfall amounts will broadly range from 3 to 5 inches across a bulk of the area, with slightly lower amounts in our far southeast, namely east of the Lakes in western Kentucky. This amount of rainfall, if realized, will lead to some flooding issues, especially where thunderstorms might locally enhance amounts or repeat over the same rain soaked terrain. WPC has upgraded nearly the entire region to a moderate risk for developing flooding issues by Friday into Friday night. Stay tuned to updates and potential Watches and Warnings as this event nears in time, and prepare with your flood safety plan accordingly.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
